age_range.evidence: Participant’s profession as a university professor, common age range for this role.

gender.evidence: Participant’s language and references to his wife.

nationality_background.evidence: References to Boston and California, common locations within the USA.

location.evidence: Participant mentions living in these cities.

living_situation.evidence: Participant states ‘I live with my wife’.

education.evidence: Holding a university professorship typically requires this level of education.

goals_and_motivations.value: Maintain a structured routine, achieve fitness goals, explore new cultures and experiences, minimize decision fatigue.
goals_and_motivations.evidence: References to planning, exercise habits, travel, and preference for familiar routines.

interests.evidence: Participant’s desire to travel to new places, try new food, and purchasing a Tesla.

values.evidence: Participant’s focus on quality products, preference for efficient shopping, and desire for organized routines.

frequency_of_use.evidence: Participant mentions shopping ‘twice or 3 times’ per week.

where_used_devices.evidence: Participant shops via multiple platforms, including Amazon.

search_style_best_vs_first.evidence: Participant initially considers the most highly rated products when choosing, but also looks for the lowest price.

price_preference_cheapest_vs_expensive.evidence: Participant consistently chooses the most affordable option when available, prioritizing value.

decision_factors.evidence: Participant explicitly states these factors influence his purchasing decisions.

preferred_categories.evidence: Participant’s purchases of toilet paper, car fluids, and Tesla accessories, as well as clothing.

pain_points_and_or_challenges.value: Decision fatigue, time constraints, complexity of choosing between similar products.
pain_points_and_or_challenges.evidence: Participant’s difficulty in determining the best windshield washer fluid and his preference for streamlined online shopping experiences.
